name: WASP-178
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-178 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-178 is a star with 2.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.67 times its radius. It is located 1363.33208 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-178 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-178 system

WASP-178 b

WASP-178 b was discovered by the WASP-South observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-178 b is 527.5978 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-178 b is 20.288 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-178 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-178 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-178, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by WASP-South.
